attributes.action: Allow gyms to remain open during this second lockdown
attributes.additional_details: Gyms are following strict guidelines provided by the government and are not high risk for transmission of COVID-19 - in fact they are a protective factor, this has been supported in research. Closure of fitness facilities leads to an increase in weight and a decrease in fitness levels, making the population more vulnerable to COVID-19 and therefore more of a strain on our health services. It also has a beneficial impact on mental health, which in the current times is more important than ever.
attributes.background: Allow the gyms to stay open during this second lockdown as long as they are following COVID guidelines.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Keep gyms and leisure facilities open during any lockdown: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556956

Prevent gyms closing due to a spike in Covid 19 cases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333869

The Committee will be holding a debate on Covid-19 restrictions on gyms and sport on Monday 23 November. You will be able to watch the debate on Parliament TV at 4.30pm: https://www.parliamentlive.tv/Commons
